qas.question: What type of religions concerns are there?

answers.text: minority religious groups undermine national unity

qas.question: What concerns for the religions institutions are there?

answers.text: a concern for religious institutions becoming active in the political sphere

qas.question: What is the name of the militant Islamic party in Tajikistan?
What does the Hizb ut-Tahrir aim for?

answers.text: aims for an overthrow of secular governments and the unification of Tajiks under one Islamic state

qas.question: There is concern among whom that majority religious groups undermine national unity?
There is concern for whom becoming active in the governmental sphere?
The party that seeks to unify Tajikistan under one Christian state is whom?
Friday prayers are available in many large what?

context: Relationships between religious groups are generally amicable, although there is some concern among <b4_0>mainstream Muslim leaders<b4_0/>[who?] that <a0_0>minority religious groups undermine national unity<a0_0/>. There is <a1_0>a concern for <b5_0>religious institutions<b5_0/> becoming active in the political sphere<a1_0/>. The Islamic Renaissance Party (IRP), a major combatant in the 1992–1997 Civil War and then-proponent of the creation of an Islamic state in Tajikistan, constitutes no more than 30% of the government by statute. Membership in <a2_0><b6_0>Hizb ut-Tahrir<b6_0/><a2_0/>, a militant Islamic party which today <a3_0>aims for an overthrow of secular governments and the unification of Tajiks under one Islamic state<a3_0/>, is illegal and members are subject to arrest and imprisonment. Numbers of large <b7_0>mosques<b7_0/> appropriate for Friday prayers are limited and some[who?] feel this is discriminatory.
